Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk NetworkManager
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: NetworkManager bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: NetworkManager is a system service that manages network interfaces and connections based on user or automatic configuration. It supports Ethernet, bridge, bond, VLAN, team, Infiniband, Wi-Fi, mobile broadband (WWAN), PPPoE, and other devices, and supports a variety of different VPN services. This update fixes the following bugs: If a connection had enabled both IPv4 and IPv6, the NetworkManager-wait-online service allowed a startup to proceed even though the connectivity was established only for one of the IP protocols. As a consequence, other network services which expected connectivity for the other IP protocol could fail. With this update, NetworkManager-wait-online waits for both IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity to be established before proceeding with activation of the network interface in this case. (BZ#1096063) When taking over existing connections, NetworkManager did not match IPv6 routes correctly. This could result in duplicate network configuration profiles being created after NetworkManager was restarted. With this update, NetworkManager handles IPv6 routes correctly and thus no longer duplicates network configuration profiles when it is restarted. (BZ#1096776) The nmcli command-line utility was not able to create VPN connections with Libreswan. This update adds support for the libreswan, ssh, and l2tp VPN types to nmcli so that nmcli is now able to create relevant VPN connection profiles. (BZ#1102051) Previously, NetworkManager did not correctly match and generate connections on IBM S/390 machines. This caused NetworkManager to create duplicate network configuration profiles after it was restarted. This update ensures that NetworkManager handles connections on IBM S/390 machines as expected. (BZ#1102052) When restarted, NetworkManager could activate incorrect network configuration profile because it selected the profile with the oldest time stamp. With this update, NetworkManager correctly activates the most recently used network configuration profile after it is restarted. (BZ#1102764) Due to a bug in the text user interface for NetworkManager, nmtui, the nmtui client could terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault when adding or editing IPv6 addresses or routes. This updates fixes this problem and ensures that nmtui no longer crashes under these circumstances. In addition, nmtui now handles cloned MAC addresses as expected. (BZ#1103802) Due to a race condition, NetworkManager could set an incorrect firewall zone for an active connection. As a consequence, the respective network interface was assigned to the wrong firewall zone and the firewall command failed with a ZONE_CONFLICT error. This update applies a series of patches ensuring that NetworkManager assigns an active network interface to the correct firewall zone without any problems. (BZ#1104728) Users of NetworkManager are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
